Description: Shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; exterior, part of band probably of tongues at top of shoulder; below, painted decoration consisting of goat (head missing) with added red blobs on body, to right; dot rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 41, no. 150, pl. 36, no. 26163)
Edgar 1911 / Catalogue Générale des antiquités égyptiennes du musée du Caire, Greek Vases (p. 14, no. 26163)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.007)
